skill.name: geo-database
skill.description: Access NCBI GEO for gene expression/genomics data. Search/download microarray and RNA-seq datasets (GSE, GSM, GPL), retrieve SOFT/Matrix files, for transcriptomics and expression analysis.
skill.summary: Access NCBI GEO for gene expression/genomics data. Search/download microarray and RNA-seq datasets (...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is a legitimate scientific data access tool for NCBI's GEO database. The static analysis flagged many false positives related to normal network operations, FTP access, and API key usage. All external commands are legitimate data science operations (pip installs, wget/curl for data downloads). No actual security risks identified.

content.user_title: Access NCBI GEO gene expression data
content.value_statement: Researchers need efficient access to gene expression datasets for analysis. This skill enables querying, downloading, and analyzing data from NCBI's GEO database containing millions of genomics samples.
actual_capabilities: Search GEO datasets by keywords, organism, or conditions
Parse SOFT and MINiML file formats
limitations: Requires internet connection for data access
Large datasets may require significant disk space
NCBI rate limits apply without API key
Some older datasets lack matrix files

use_cases.title: Analyze gene expression in disease
use_cases.description: Download and compare gene expression data between healthy and diseased tissue samples to identify biomarkers.

use_cases.title: Meta-analysis across studies
use_cases.description: Combine data from multiple GEO studies to increase statistical power for detecting gene expression changes.

use_cases.title: Build predictive models
use_cases.description: Use GEO expression data to train machine learning models for drug response prediction or patient stratification.

prompt_templates.title: Search for datasets
prompt_templates.prompt: Search GEO for human breast cancer gene expression datasets from the last 5 years. Show me the top 5 results with sample counts and platforms used.

prompt_templates.title: Download expression data
prompt_templates.prompt: Download the expression matrix and metadata for GSE12345. Save the files to ./data/ and show me a summary of the dataset including number of samples and genes.

prompt_templates.title: Differential expression
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform differential expression analysis on GSE12345 comparing treatment vs control samples. Use limma or t-test and show me the top 10 most significant genes.

prompt_templates.title: Batch processing
prompt_templates.prompt: Download and process these 3 GEO series: GSE100001, GSE100002, GSE100003. Extract expression data and create a summary table with study metadata.

output_examples.input: Search for diabetes gene expression datasets in humans
output: Found 1,247 datasets matching 'diabetes AND Homo sapiens'
- GSE12345: Type 2 diabetes gene expression (47 samples)
- GSE11111: Insulin response time course (24 samples)

best_practices: Always set your email when using NCBI E-utilities
Use API key for better rate limits on large queries
Cache downloaded files locally to avoid re-downloading
anti_patterns: Don't download entire GEO database - be selective
Avoid hardcoding API keys in shared code
Don't ignore sample metadata when analyzing expression data

faq.question: Do I need an API key?
faq.answer: Optional but recommended. Without key: 3 requests/second. With key: 10 requests/second. Get free key at ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/account/

faq.question: What's the difference between GSE, GSM, and GPL?
faq.answer: GSE = complete study, GSM = individual sample, GPL = microarray/sequencing platform. Use GSE for full datasets.

faq.question: Why can't I find expression data for some series?
faq.answer: Older submissions may lack matrix files. Download family SOFT file or parse individual sample tables instead.

faq.question: How do I handle large datasets?
faq.answer: Use FTP downloads for bulk data, process in chunks, and consider sparse matrices for memory efficiency.

faq.question: Can I use this for clinical research?
faq.answer: Yes, GEO data is public. Always cite original studies and verify data quality for clinical applications.

faq.question: What's the best format for expression data?
faq.answer: Series matrix files are fastest. Use SOFT for complete metadata, MINiML for XML processing.
